The Commissioner is right when he takes the colors out of those members of the Council who are unable to show solidarity at this time.
I encourage the Polish presidency to continue supporting this program before the end of its presidency.
Lo merece.
Y lo merecen todas las personas que lo necesitan y merece también esta Unión Europea ese voto de confianza y, sobre todo, esa respuesta a sus ciudadanos.
The Council of Ministers of the Union should also take into account the opinion of Parliament, not only to maintain the program, but also to improve it, as this Chamber has already requested.
I would also like to remind the heads of state and government that we hope that we trust that in their next summit they will take this matter seriously and politically unlock this situation.
Thank you, Madam President. Thank you, Commissioner. As you know, Commissioner, Parliament in its day rejected in 2008 in a forceful manner the resolution proposal that was presented.
Afterwards, in the same terms, the report that I myself presented to the chamber was approved by a large majority, with a great consensus and with the effort of the commission and the groups.
What were the reasons for this change of attitude of the Parliament?

Without a doubt, all the requirements that demanded the acceptance of the use of these scanners, preservation of fundamental rights and within these, especially the dignity and privacy of the passenger, non-discrimination, protection of personal data and health protection.
Así se llegó a establecer qué tipo de escáneres eran los idóneos para garantizar, de un lado, la seguridad del pasajero y, del otro, preservar sus derechos e intereses.
The scanners will not use ionizing radiation, will not be mandatory for states or citizens, and will all protect the rights previously described.

The Commission has taken all these concerns into account, it is true, in its future legislation, but it also includes, in addition to the scanners of standard figures, the possibility of another modality that, by guaranteeing the same list of rights, allows the inspection of an image, even if it is blurry, of the passenger.
We accept the reasons why this alternative has been included as an authorized control method.
The Parliament also defends the need to guarantee a fair competition and thus escape any monopolistic temptation.
However, we ask the Commission to maintain all the precepts that we have defended in my report, all the guarantees of preservation of fundamental rights.

In addition, it is encouraged to work with the industry and the Member States to ensure that in the near future only the automatic protection shields are used and that it is not necessary for an inspector to view any images.

Our British colleagues from the House of Commons, honoring the admirable and historic parliamentary and democratic tradition of their country, have highlighted the intolerable practices of the Murdoch Group.
También encomiable la valentía de The Guardian.
Pero los aberrantes tentáculos de Murdoch alcanzan otras latitudes.
In Spain, they have in their payroll with a millionaire salary to Jose Maria Aznar, former president of the government, who wants to continue influencing Spanish and even European politics.
Vamos a entrar en campaña electoral.
El Partido Popular y su líder, el señor Rajoy, deberían aclarar antes de esa campaña a todos los europeos de qué forma les apoya el señor Murdock y su gabinete, qué es lo que
The magnate demands, in exchange for financially supporting Mr. Aznar and his foundation, and if that plot has anything to do with what happened in the United Kingdom, conveniently revealed.

From the directive on the rights of victims of crimes, including terrorism, and as a Spanish citizen who has directly suffered the cruelty of the terrorist organization ETA, I want to thank President Bush for his support to my country and its victims.

I understand the satisfaction of many with this new ETA statement, but I must remind you that we cannot start the countdown to the flight because today they have not delivered the weapons, they have not dissolved, nor have they asked for forgiveness from their victims.
It is also important that your Lordships know that in Spain we do not have to achieve any peace between two sides because there has been no war.

My brother Alberto Jimenez Becerril, murdered by ETA in Seville along with his wife, did not come from the war, he was going to his home where his three children were waiting, who would never see him again.
We have the obligation to explain to my brother's children that their parents were better than those who murdered them.
If we accept an ending without winners or losers, we will be teaching those children that killing is a way to achieve political goals.
I ask for the support of this chamber so that it is not deceived by the terrorists and their accomplices, and listen to the sincere voices of the victims, who only want peace that comes from justice.
Hay que romper la estrategia y la táctica de Arcelor Mittal.
I have always opposed the entry of this predator and dislocator businessman, Mr. Mittal, into Europe.
Do not allow, Commissioner, the social barbarity of Mr. Mittal and his leaders, who have already enriched themselves so much with the stock options of Arcelor.
Address Mr. Commissioner, on behalf of Europe, on behalf of European workers, of the peoples of Europe, address Mr. Mittal, once and for all.
Congratulations on your upcoming parenthood, Mr. Stoianoff.
We have finished with this intervention the turn of the eye of the President in a debate that I think has been one of the most fascinating that I have had the opportunity to preside over.
And I am sure that my male colleagues will not be offended if I say that, as is almost always the case, it is the ladies who take the floor, and the debates are usually extremely interesting.

We are going to give the floor then to the representation of the Council, to Mr. Radoslavecko, so that he can conclude by reacting to the set of interventions that have taken place on such an important issue.
The governments of the member states do not want to give a joint response to a situation of war and profound social and political change on our borders.

Against my report on the conditions of reception of asylum seekers, they strive to systematically incarcerate the asylum seekers, those precisely who flee their countries to defend our freedom, our freedom and theirs, which are inseparable.
La detención de asilados es a la vez cara e injusta. Impide que estas personas se puedan.
Recover from the traumas they have experienced. Criminalize those who have suffered humanitarian crimes. Waste resources of all.
Let's make use instead of the alternative measures to detention.
In an increasingly bipolar world and with our fallen economy, Europe is condemned to indifference and failure.
Let us reactivate our values.
I agree with the questions that my colleague and great friend, Mr Tavares, has raised here.
Ladies and gentlemen, this crisis is teaching us a lot, but there is one that seems to me of special importance, and it is precisely the following:
It is necessary in the future to modify the Treaties to thoroughly reform the decision-making and agreement adoption procedure within the European institutions.
The diabolical system in force today is slow, desperate, and also full of whims.
These vices lead us to inaction and sometimes to paralysis, and from paralysis it is easy to reach economic ruin.
I will repeat it as many times as I can from this modest box. A federal state can work well or badly. A confederation never works.

Thank you very much, Madam President, Commissioner, Ladies and Gentlemen, citizens demand from Europe solutions to the problems and that Europe is capable of achieving a sustainable economic recovery and that it contributes to the simplification and flexibility of regulations.
The mobility of professionals is not only a fundamental right enshrined in the Treaties, it is also a key factor for the modernization of the labor market and economic development.
Therefore, it is necessary to adapt and update the system for the recognition of professional qualifications to the reality of work and the demands and needs of professionals and consumers.

The future proposal of the Commission should consider greater transparency and simplification in the rules for recognizing professional qualifications, an evaluation of compensatory measures to solve existing problems, and greater

Clarification of the criteria regarding linguistic knowledge to ensure the quality of services provided and protect the safety of consumers and patients, and greater cooperation and coordination between the competent authorities and national contact points.
Ladies and gentlemen, Europe must place professionals and consumers at the heart of the single market.
Only in this way can we build an exit to the financial and economic crisis based on sustainable knowledge and social progress.
Thank you very much, Mr. President, ladies and gentlemen, we are dealing with an extremely sensitive issue.
On the one hand, we must take into account cultural traditions and the important sustainable contribution in some states, such as mine, of the game to society through education, culture, and sport.
And, on the other hand, we must fight against the criminality linked to gambling and protect consumers, especially the most vulnerable, to avoid excessive or pathological gambling.
Por ello, creo que en este ámbito debe prevalecer el principio de subsidiariedad activa, basado en la cooperación entre las administraciones nacionales.

However, we must be ambitious and bet on the development of common standards and coordinated joint action against online and regular gambling operators that operate without the necessary national licenses.
Likewise, we must ensure transparency and make it possible to have a non-discriminatory competence that pursues the public interest and consumer protection.
Finally, we must promote the formation of a network of national organizations that deal with gambling addicts, in order to make possible an exchange of experience and accredited practices.

Thank you, Madam President, ladies and gentlemen. I would like to congratulate my friend Kasmarek on his good report and on his generous flexibility in accepting the amendments that I presented to his initial proposal.

After expressing my agreement with much of what has been said here and with the text that we will vote on tomorrow, I will express some satisfaction, some concern, and some ideas regarding the work that we have come and will continue to develop from the European Parliament in the Parliamentary Assembly, Paritary Africa, Caribbean, Pacific, European Union.

My satisfaction goes to the work of my colleague Luis Michel as co-president of the Assembly and to our friends in the Commission, with Commissioner Piebalgs at the head, for their interest, attention and participation in our tasks, with the simplicity, cordiality and efficiency that characterize them.

I am concerned, on the other hand, that, absorbed by the rest of the work that colleagues are developing in the Euro Parliament, a notable absence of our representatives in the plenary session, whose work we are here evaluating, is being produced.
It seems evident to me that colleagues who consider other occupations as a priority should analyze the situation well.
To emphasize the importance of your work in the assembly, the ACP, the European Union, and to make way for other colleagues who may have more time for this activity.
Por otra parte, creo que nuestro Parlamento, como tal, debería conceder más atención a esta misma labor, que debería entenderse la importancia política que tiene el Acuerdo de Catanú, que.
Constituye la instancia más representativa de la cooperación norte sur, con casi ochenta países del mundo en desarrollo, además de los veintisiete ya pronto veintiocho que integran la Unión Europea.
At the time when global governance must be articulated in a multilateral key, our partners in the ACP constitute a huge political potential to articulate joint actions on the international scene.
Our Parliament must also pay greater attention to the resolutions that our delegates approve with their ACP colleagues in the parliamentary assembly.

We should not continue to approve all kinds of resolutions with the signature of the European Parliament without even taking note of these texts, at least in the corresponding committees of our House.

The relevant measures must be studied so that, knowing what is debated and approved in the ACP-EU Assembly, the texts that our Parliament approves in the same areas are coherent and do not give rise, as sometimes it can happen, to notable and frankly disconcerting discrepancies for our interlocutors.
Thank you, Mr. President, Mr. Commissioner Cholo, I am pleased that you are here with us this morning and I hope that you will answer me more seriously and more clearly today.

In the proposal for the reform of the common agricultural policy that you presented to us on October 12th, you speak of the suppression of the sugar quota regime and also speak of the maintenance of the rights to planting vineyards.
The European Parliament, in the report of Mr. Dess, which we have recently voted on in this Chamber, is in favor of continuing with plantation rights from the year
2015 y que no se liberalicen los derechos de plantación de viñedo y es también partidario de al menos mantener el régimen de cuotas de azúcar hasta el año 2020 al menos.
At least I ask you, are you going to continue and support the situation of the Parliament and the decision of the Parliament on these two issues?
Traditional, well, Commissioner, given that there are already fifteen Member States in the Council that think differently than they did previously.
Given that Parliament continues to bet on the rights of planting vineyards, we can be relatively optimistic about the Commission's proposal for next year in the wine report.
Thank you for the explanation, but in truth, at this moment, the number of subsidies that Valencian farmers receive is almost zero.
Valencian farmers do not live off subsidies.
We hope that the recognition of that capacity, the small farmer that you have just defined and that the Member States will give us, will provide clarity on the current situation.
Mr President, the report by my colleague Le Pen points well to the fundamental issue of pooling efforts in the fight against illegal fishing.
The objectives of a common policy of sustainable fishing, marine environment protection and promotion of fair fishing are undermined if we do not fight this illegal fishing in a committed way.
The oceans do not have borders, so efforts must be made both at the European and international levels.

Therefore, the European Union must be credible in its policies and must sanction practices such as those recently published, in which ships flying the community flag operate illegally in waters protected by conservation measures.
The problem of illegal fishing is not only a matter of boats with the flag of third countries, but also a problem of European operators.

Furthermore, we cannot move forward without a strong financial instrument that conditions access to public money to the strict implementation of effective controls and the application of all fishing regulations.
I think it is very important to closely follow the application of the European order of protection.
We talk about denouncing, but these denunciations must be followed by real protection.

We need funds. We can pass good laws, but if we do not provide the countries with the appropriate means, the victims will not trust and will continue to remain silent for fear of being attacked again.
Therefore, it is necessary for judges and police officers to have the training and resources to do their jobs well.
Esa es la verdadera justicia.
So many victims complain that an application of the law does not correspond to what they need.
It is therefore necessary that we join efforts, that we insist on statistics to see how this instrument works, which I believe is truly necessary.
I ask the states to make an effort to understand and apply this Euro order, because for this we have worked and we believe that we have made it clear.

I believe that from now on, the European doors of the rights of the victims are open, so that women and men will be able to count on this and other instruments that will make the victims come to light and stop those who intimidate them.

Today, with our voices here and tomorrow, with our votes, we will tell the victims that in the European Parliament we will never forget their rights, the support that society owes them, and most importantly, justice.
Because I tell you that it is justice that keeps all the victims alive.
Thank you, Mr. President, thank you to the Council Presidency and to the Commission, Commissioner, and thank you to all those who have spoken.
Pero faltaría la sinceridad si no dijera también alguna cosa. Cada uno somos libres en esta Cámara de defender aquellos intereses que consideramos oportunos, sean de un sector industrial o de quien.
Let's be honest, but I think we have to be honest with ourselves and with others, and not camouflage the defense of what we are defending with other names or with issues that cover it up.

Because I have to say that not a single one of the spokespersons who have worked, who have worked well, even like Mr. Litter, have contributed to this note of humor that was long overdue. None of them have had any complaints from any consumer association.
Therefore, it cannot be said here that we are not collaborating with consumer information or that someone can claim to be a defender of consumers more than their own associations.
Esa no es nuestra pretensión.
It is advisable to read this directive carefully and to respect the work that has been done.

Y quiero también dedicar unas palabras a tres intervenciones, la de la señora Rees, la del señor Kelly y la de la señora Nedelcheva, en la referencia que han hecho a la necesidad de potenciar y consumir los productos de proximidad, porque es verdad que la Unión Europea no importa en qué país se produzca, más o menos.

At least it is a consumer and producer power of fruits and packaged juices, and we should, for the sake of CO2 emissions savings in the atmosphere and to boost our own in times of crisis, especially in agriculture, boost the consumption of our products to the maximum.
Por tanto, esas tres intervenciones que han hablado de eso cuentan con mi respaldo y me sumo a ellas.

And I also assume and support the words of the commissioner when he says that we have to strive to win in quality and quantity, we have to do it, but the union is a whole, it doesn't matter where it is produced and that has to be noticed in the fruits and in the juices.

Mr. Minister, I read the directive carefully because what you propose is full of falsehoods, because it is not allowed to add aromas of other fruits, it is said that aromas of the same species are added.

What we could not accept is something that is technically impossible, which is to add the aroma, first, obligatorily, to favor, we do not know to whom, to add that aroma of the same fruit that is being squeezed at that moment, the same juice.
Because that, when tanks of four million liters are stored and ten thousand liters are needed to extract two liters of aroma, is technically impossible and should have been told.
I really invite you, with all kindness, to read the directive that surely has changed.
Light, more light, it is said that Goethe asked for in his last moments.
Today, the poet, who was also an effective ruler, would surely nuance these statements, invoking savings and efficiency.
Because in a Europe poor in energy resources, it is essential that we know how to distinguish between necessary consumption that drives the economy and superfluous consumption.
The latter must be mastered, and for this, it is urgent to encourage a drastic change in the habits of many European citizens.
When we analyze the economic crisis, we ask for austerity and also for growth stimuli.
Well, few areas better to bring these beautiful words to reality than the energy sector, where savings and sustainability must be combined.
The necessary investments for large projects, including the construction of an integrated network of infrastructure, whose report I had the honor of presenting to this Parliament.
The Commission must make more concrete efforts than those made so far, because it would strengthen the backbone of Europe.
Only a solid and well-crafted European energy policy, efficient and saving, can allow Europe to walk upright and in the right direction.
All the details that come from the commission in this regard, which I have pointed out in my words, will be well received.
Mr. President, after the climate conferences already held since 1995, it can be affirmed that, as they are conceived, they have been doomed to failure.

In fact, a global agreement is sought and, moreover, to reach it by consensus, an aspiration impossible to achieve as a consequence of the very different productive, economic and social structure of the states.
Por ello, al final se pretenden conseguir mínimos, pero estos son claramente insuficientes.

On the other hand, after the climate change, very deep problems of societies are hidden, such as their development and educational models, social differences, poverty, etc. If all of them are taken into account,

At these summits, the difficulties in reaching these agreements will increase, especially if, as is the case, they become large fairs, large international exhibitions with thousands and thousands of participants.
La Unión Europea debe mantener izadas sus banderas medioambientales, lo que ha hecho muy bien en Durban la comisaria Hedegaard.
Por ello, mi felicitación.
These summits, Mr. President, ladies and gentlemen, would require greater coherence among the states, more diplomatic work, and less festival display.

Thank you, Madam President, Commissioner, ladies and gentlemen, my first words are of gratitude to my colleague, Mrs. Patraux, because during these months she has defended to the wind and tide the opportunity and the of this resolution that we are debating today and that we will vote on later.
There have been many obstacles that Mrs. Patraux has had to overcome with the support of the Popular Group, and I would like to congratulate her on the work that has led us to today.
Ladies and gentlemen, fifty years ago, the farmer received fifty percent of the final price that the consumer paid. However, in many cases, this is now not even ten percent.
At the same time, in twenty years, the distribution chains have gone from having a twenty-one point seven percent of market share to a seventy point eight percent.
"Algo está pasando y es evidente."
Measures must be taken to make the food distribution chain more equitable, more egalitarian, more just.

First, we must improve the security networks that the common agricultural policy provides us with to ensure adequate prices. We must provide a community framework that ensures balance and avoids abuses. We must specify and prohibit abusive practices.

Abusivas en esos márgenes comerciales habrá que concentrar la producción fomentando las organizaciones de productores de agricultores y ganaderos y habrá que asegurar condiciones iguales de competencia para todos los productores.

Equal opportunities and equal obligations. And I am referring to those producers who are outside the European Union and do not comply with the same quality, food safety, animal welfare standards and all those things that are so necessary that we obligate our producers to do.
Where do we do all this?
Pues en la próxima reforma de la PAC.
We have to improve the contractual relations in that reform of the PAC.
The objective? To improve the positioning of the primary sector within the chain, to improve the commercial policy of distribution, to improve a constant increase in food speculation.
Take into account and improve those margins that are causing an increase in non-agricultural costs. And finally, ensure that all products in the Union's market meet the same quality standards.
Thank you, Mr. President. Intellectual property violations may seem like a game, but they kill the game.

They eliminate equality in the free game of competition so that the most deceitful player wins. This is the one who does not respect the rules, the one who does not pay taxes, the one who does not comply with the rights of workers or customers.
In this report, we have once and for all overcome the term piracy.
We believe that the term piracy is a misnomer, as we do not understand well what its relationship is with the approach of ships in the sea or with the mythical corsair legends.
Hasta los propios infractores han hecho a veces bandera de este término para presentarse como adalid de la libertad.
Su lucha es vana porque acaban sirviendo a los intereses de grandes multinacionales que quieren disponer de contenido sin pagar.
Let's call them infractions, for what they are, infractions.
To pan, pan and to vino, vino, we say in Spanish.
The observatory is located in Alicante, where the trademark registry is already operating with full success. You are going to reveal with figures truths that do not seem so obvious to everyone.
The Observatory will propose and, above all, inform about the situation in the sector and compliance with the standards.
In addition, the text includes an additional guarantee for data protection.
As the observatory will be a meeting platform between the public and private sectors, the composition is key.

I have therefore insisted on the inclusion of the creative sector to consider the dimension of employment, especially and the annual examination in the management report that there is a balanced representation of the actors involved.
The Observatory will undoubtedly be a very important piece in the essential monitoring of respect for intellectual property.

Madam President, Commissioner, ladies and gentlemen, we know that without young people there is no future, and we are also certain that with the high rates of youth unemployment, Europe can be unsustainable.

It is a priority to provide solutions that will not arrive with labor reforms such as the one approved last Friday in my country, which will lead our young people to more job insecurity and the demolition of rights.
The reality is that Europe has a youth unemployment rate close to 23%.
In my country, in Spain, it affects forty-nine percent of young people, many of them trained, prepared, and talented, who are expressing their fatigue and frustration due to a lack of solutions.
We share the urgency of approving measures to promote youth employment and help SMEs, especially those created by young people.
Por ello, considero prioritario la necesidad de adecuar la formación al mercado de trabajo, entendiendo que un sistema de formación con más equidad en la calidad de la educación y que ponga fin a la.
The differences between public and private education will serve to stimulate creativity and innovation, thus increasing the entrepreneurial spirit, specialization, and mobility of students.
Students, could you explain to the Commission how the ten thousand seven hundred million that the Commission has estimated corresponds to Spain will be distributed among the different funds?
Regarding the European Social Fund, what percentage of the eighty-two billion euros that are yet to be allocated will go to this fund?
Specifically, in the case of Spain, how much does this percentage amount to?
And finally, how does the Commission plan to integrate regional and local authorities and social interlocutors into the action plans?
I hope, Commissioner, for a quick, decisive and viable action by the Commission, because there is not just one day to lose.
Thank you, Madam President. I congratulate the election yesterday in the primaries of Governor Capriles as candidate of the United Democratic Opposition of Venezuela.
I vote because alternation can take place if the Venezuelans, mostly, want it in that beloved country, with the electoral guarantees compatible with democracy.
Translation: Good luck Venezuela.
Thank you, Mr. President. In addition to the eighty million poor people we are talking about, there are forty-three million more people who have difficulty getting animal protein twice a week.
This situation could also worsen because those who have difficulty getting protein twice a week could fall into the group of the desperate, since the economic crisis.
It continues to worsen, and this is precisely the best time for the European Union to make budgetary savings in food aid for the next financial perspective period.

The agreement that the European Parliament endorses extends food aid under the conditions requested by this very chamber, but that also means, at the same time, a bit of resignation in the face of the blockade that some Member States have maintained for several months in the Council.
I would like to encourage all the gentlemen to undertake the necessary initiatives to revive food aid from 2014.
The European Parliament should not stand idly by in the face of such an important issue, speaking humanely.
We should not allow things to remain like this, so we would have to take advantage of the next period of financial perspectives negotiations to express our opinion.
Regarding this, and to force an agreement with the Council of Ministers and this Parliament to allow the preservation of aid to the poorest beyond that date.
Thanks to European aid, food banks have done a remarkable social work that should not be paralyzed by the selfishness of some governments.
This work has benefited 13 million people and, thanks to it, with minimal effort, we have managed to make the common agricultural policy a little more important.

Thank you, Mr. President. The regulation we are discussing today is not perfect. It cannot, on its own, solve the problems of a sector with structural problems and also due to the economic context we are living in, with cyclical problems.
But this regulation, without being perfect, is a step forward, determined and in the right direction.

Because if in the last period we have all realized that there is no perfect market, it was very necessary to introduce in this table, where we are also playing with the food security of the people, all the regulatory elements that we could and protect our producers.

It was very necessary that we allow the binding nature of contracts with a maximum time, a minimum term and a maximum volume, at least as a defense instrument, because of course our producers do not start with the same negotiating strength against distributors, intermediaries or collectors.
There are many things to do.
We must improve the security networks and make them more agile and effective.
We must bet on further diversifying the sector in the value chain, controlling the distribution of quotas, especially in certain areas, or promoting quality policy.

But without any doubt, with our positive vote and with everything that remains to be done, today many farmers will be able to see this parliament that has defended their labor rights, the most basic of all, which is the right to live with dignity from the income of their work.
The OECD has rightly pointed out the disastrous consequences that the approval of this agreement would entail.
Because this agreement, which expands the contingencies for certain horticultural products when the figures of the present agreement are not respected, is absolutely meaningless.

It is worth remembering that the Spanish Federation of Fruit and Vegetable Producers and Exporters denounced to the Committee on Petitions, precisely from this Parliament, the massive entry of tomatoes through Perpignan at a price lower than the one agreed upon.
Illegal situations like the one described put the European farmer at a competitive disadvantage.
It should also be added that our farmers must respect rigorous quality, environmental and social standards that our Moroccan partners do not always respect.
To conclude, I will point out the issue of the Sahara.
According to the United Nations Charter, the Sahara is an autonomous territory and the exploitation of its resources must benefit precisely the local population.
Furthermore, it constitutes a zone over which the UN does not recognize the sovereignty of the Kingdom of Morocco.
From the European Union, we must ensure compliance with international law.

I am in favor of an agreement with Morocco, in favor of an agreement that establishes rigorous control mechanisms from the European Union in relation to quotas and prices, an agreement that fights against dumping, that does not exploit the Moroccan farmer and, above all, that dignifies our European farmers.
No es, desde luego, este acuerdo.

This year, the European Parliament's Committee on Petitions asked the European Commission to proceed with a modification of the regime of entry prices for fruits and vegetables in the Union, a regime that is facilitating the fraudulent entry of productions from third countries, as declared by the Union's own anti-fraud agency, OLAF.
Principalmente son tomates marroquíes.
The same request has been included in a statement signed last year by the governments of Spain, France and Italy.

This fraud is resolved by modifying the implementation rules of the common agricultural products market organization, because the alignment of the General Data Protection Regulation does not solve the problem, Mr. Commissioner.

For several years, I have defended within the Popular Party the need to halt new concessions to Morocco until the European Union is equipped with the necessary instruments to ensure compliance with the current agreement.
The European Commission argues that it is the Member States who must ensure the control of imports.

However, what the Commission does not say is that the system of input prices is in force, which prevents national customs authorities from making a correct traceability of the prices declared by importers to verify that there are no irregularities.

Modify the OCM's implementation rules for agricultural products and we will have resolved part of the problem, because otherwise the legal gap in European legislation prevents national authorities from doing their job correctly.
Not written again, dear colleagues, the debate about a summit.
Many have been celebrated, all announced with great fanfare, trying to create an expectation that is decreasing every day.
They are becoming less credible because they do not contribute to solving the crisis.
Summits in which the same agreements are reiterated over and over again.

It should be known that as long as there is no progress in political union and in strengthening this parliament and the executive power of the European Commission, the summits will be repeated, but the economic crisis will be aggravated.
In a telegraphic manner, two ideas: the first, the need to insist that responsible solidarity and the fulfillment of duties are the
Materials with which Europe is built. The second, that the use of structural funds that are not disbursed is authorized immediately.
These amounts can freely allow the fight against the unemployment figures of young European citizens.

Thank you, Madam President. From the European Parliament, I would like to pay tribute today to all women, who, despite the fact that we have made great progress since March 1911, when women went out into the streets to demand the vote and better working conditions, I believe that gender equality is still very far away.
Today, women can work without having to ask anyone for permission, but in many cases they still earn less than men for similar work, which is unacceptable.
We must also remember the women in the rural world whose work is ignored.
I believe that another uncomfortable reality, but one that must continue to be denounced, is violence against women.
This year alone, there has been an excessive number of women murdered, not to mention the serious threats from those who claim the right to exercise physical or psychological violence against them.
It is time to say enough and to say it loud and clear.
From this Parliament, I reiterate my commitment to the European Order of Victims Protection and to the Victims Directive that the Commission presented, which will be voted on, God willing, next June.
We also have to say, and I would like to remember, that motherhood remains an obstacle to the progress of women, and I believe it is a trend that needs to be changed.
I want to launch a message of hope and with many women, with the help of more and more men, we have to move forward on the path of equality, of opportunities, rights and also of duties.
We have come a long way, but there is still much to do.
I have to acknowledge that I do not believe absolutely and deeply in quotas, but I have to tell you that something has to be done and I agree with you.
Muchas de mis colegas y por supuesto, con la señora Reding, de abrir este debate y de avanzar en ese camino para que las mujeres recuperen el sitio que merecen y con ello puede contar con mi ayuda.

Thank you, Mr. President, in a time of economic crisis and budget cuts that is affecting both public health and in which, as in the case of the community in which I live, research centers such as the Prince Felipe Institute for Diabetes Research are left without funds. The European social model, of which we are so proud, is not based only on our pension, education or health systems, but also on a way of understanding the balance between employer and worker within companies.

The labor reform that the government of Spain has approved without dialogue and without consensus breaks with that social model and takes us away from the objectives of the 2020 strategy, both in terms of job creation and the quality of the jobs themselves.
A labor reform alone does not create jobs, it is economic growth that does.
What a labor law does is define the conditions under which workers enter companies, the conditions under which they remain in them, and the conditions under which they leave them.

Y con esta reforma, donde el ochenta por ciento de los trabajadores quedarán desprotegidos porque no estarán sujetos a convenios colectivos, donde podrán ser despedidos por una bajada de los ingresos de las empresas.

That they will be able to unilaterally modify their schedules. What is clear is that workers will enter with greater precariousness, remain in the labor market with more fear, and leave it with less compensation.

Therefore, this reform, which attacks the European social model and which bets on the competitiveness of the Spanish economy only in relation to the conditions of the workers, deserves a general strike, like the one that is to be called tomorrow in Spain in defense of this social model.

Now, the work of Turmes and the rest of the spokespeople will be of no use if it is not accompanied by decisive action from the Member States.
An action that, in turn, must be accompanied by a firm commitment to these objectives on the part of the regions, municipalities, and European citizens.
I am interested in highlighting the participation of the latter.
At the moment, what is being warned against is a lot of frivolity between the authorities and the citizens.
Citizens, we do not see, dear colleagues, in the harsh European winter, people sitting on street terraces with heating.
Friend Turnes, we must not spare efforts to save energy.
We must congratulate the rapporteur, Airatxe Garcia, for the work she has done and congratulate ourselves for the agreement reached between Parliament and the Council of Ministers.
It's a shame that tonight the council won't be with us.
The new quality scheme for agricultural products involves a simplification of the system and a streamlining of existing authorization procedures, which is good news.

Furthermore, it is a good achievement that the obligation to use the community logo for protected origin and geographical indications has been included, because this allows for the improvement of the visibility of European productions.
It also seems to me that it is noteworthy that the provisions for the protection of quality appeals in bilateral agreements with third countries are strengthened and a legal basis is created for the
To defend the European Union's logo in those third countries, because I sincerely believe that the protection of European products in third countries should be an irreplaceable objective.

It is a pity that during the negotiation this package has been left a little out of date and a pity, I say again that the Council is not here to listen to it, because the original quality package that was proposed.
The Commission has somewhat forgotten the commercial standards and the management of the offer by the quality origin denominations, detached from the agreement and, as I say, leaving it a bit empty.
I believe that we need to strengthen the lock that the Council has demonstrated in these two issues, refusing to listen to the positions of the Parliament, which are reasonable.
The management of the offer by the origin denominations would have to have been defended and will be defended, of course, in the OCMU.

The work of the rapporteur, Mr. President, is very good, but I want to take this opportunity to say here, in this framework, that our prose is very confusing, as anyone who approaches European legislation can see.
We forget what Pufendorf already taught us, that general laws must be few and their meaning must be correctly understood.
For them, those who promulgate it, must use all the clarity that is possible.
Montesquieu insisted that legal language must be precise and concise.
That is to say, we must avoid esoteric jargon full of neologisms and unjustified linguistic loans, because it generates a malevolent network where traps nest and arbitrariness takes root.
We deal with very complex issues in this Parliament, but it is our obligation to make them reach the citizens in a comprehensible and accessible way.
It is common for even the same legal professionals, judges, lawyers, to despair before our texts.
Good prose, dear colleagues, is the courtesy of the legislator and a way to show respect to the citizen.
Mr. Deputy, I have just used the little time I had to insult, disqualify from the most absolute ignorance.
Ignorancia. Do you know the Spanish Constitution?

Because what Mr. Vidal Cuadra has said is nothing more than the application of what is said in the Spanish Constitution. The rest are singular personal opinions that are absolutely irrelevant and that I can respect, but that I despise.
Thank you, Mr. President. There is, gentlemen, an old principle that has passed from the legal to the political sphere and is the pacta sunt servanda, that is, agreements must be fulfilled.
By this, I mean the important measures that the European Council adopted in June to address the crisis that affects us.

Since the adoption of these agreements, market pressure has eased and they have positively welcomed decisions that can break the vicious circle between sovereign debt and banks, as well as plans to move towards a genuine economic and monetary union and the commitment to defend the euro in an irreversible way.
The European Council held last week contains, ladies and gentlemen, undeniable positive aspects. The conclusions of the progress towards the banking union are satisfactory.
It is also positive that the agreement on twenty-seven for the launch of the banking supervisor. Finally, it is appropriate that the launch is entrusted to the ministers of the eurozone's economy.
But are they going to allow me to make a critical judgment with the biased interpretations that have unilaterally been made of it?

It is not advisable, ladies and gentlemen, to make particular interpretations that can distort the mandate granted to the ministers of economy, as we do not applaud the reporting of issues as agreements that were not even discussed.
It is urgent to move forward towards a single supervision mechanism that must cover all financial entities.
A common deposit guarantee scheme and a crisis resolution mechanism are also needed.
The survival of the euro is linked to the urgent creation of an effective banking union.

Thank you very much, Madam President, ladies and gentlemen, Commissioner. The advantages of the internal market are unquestionable. Increase in competition, increase in the supply of products and services.
Servicios, creación de nuevos empleos, precios más asequibles para los consumidores y mayor protección, todavía no suficientes y no podemos caer en la complacencia.
However, cultural, linguistic, protectionist and bureaucratic barriers prevent citizens and companies from fully taking advantage of the single market.
Hace año y medio celebrábamos la presentación de las doce prioridades para estimular el crecimiento y reforzar la confianza de los ciudadanos en el mercado interior.
Unfortunately, an agreement has not yet been reached on most of the proposals, as the Commission recognized in last week's communication.

Ladies and gentlemen, Commissioner, the urgency of the crisis forces us to be ambitious, to go much further and to achieve agreements as soon as possible to promote growth, employment and the confidence of citizens and companies in the single market.
I also want to congratulate the speaker and the rest of the colleagues who have worked on this reform very appropriately.

The financial crisis has been exacerbated by the existence of complex and strange negotiable values that are linked to derivative instruments and negotiations outside of official markets, all with the aim of achieving high returns at great speed.
It is necessary to attract to a transparent market the financial operations to guarantee the good formation of prices and the competitiveness of negotiable products.
But above all, it is essential that the information provided is understandable for investors who must have full knowledge to freely consent to the risks they assume.
Transparency is of no use as a great beam of light if the entanglement in the configuration of negotiable products blinds the understanding of citizens.
I like the report of Mrs Thyssen because I believe that anything that strengthens the role and authority of this Parliament in political debate is a step in the right direction.
All too often, we hear the accusation of European institutions for their lack of democratic quality.
This is a light-hearted statement that is not the occasion to enter this debate.

Yes, to emphasize that this parliament has the same legitimacy as any national parliament, and it is likely that, with respect to some, it operates according to more transparent rules and also allows greater freedom for its members.
Therefore, all economic measures must pass the filter that this Parliament represents before their final approval and then when examining their implementation and results.

President, 5.3 of the active population works in the automotive sector.
The numbers speak for themselves.
The decline in sales in the European market, coupled with the business strategy, makes it that, in general terms, the externalization and restructuring of companies.

Unfortunately, there are few cases of restructuring with a long-term vision. Generally, short-termism is rewarded, with the main element being to scan competitiveness based on labor adjustments.

I have to say that on the same day that Ford announced the suspension of the plant in Gen, the company in Valencia was informed that its production was going to be moved to Germany in the same corporate statement.

Therefore, we believe that it is a general problem of Europe. We believe that it is essential to create a legal framework at the European level that anticipates changes and highlights the importance of social dialogue.
Social dialogue is fundamental.
We are discussing today four reports that suggest a revitalization of our common security and defense policy.
It is a clear sign of the conviction that our security and defense have a clear European dimension, in the face of the minority euro-sceptic sectors that also campaign in this chamber.
The report of Mr. Danjean, to whom I would like to thank his spirit of seeking consensus during the elaboration of the same, contains important contributions from the social group.
Among others, references to effective multilateralism, the principle of the responsibility to protect, or the concept of human security.
And we would like to see these aspects included in the possible revision of the European defense strategy.
We have also pointed out that a common policy of strong security and defense is also in the interest of our transatlantic alliance.
I must highlight another challenge that is taking on important dimensions for our global security.
It is about cybersecurity and cyber defense, reports that we are also discussing today and whose suggestions we hope will be included in the new European cybersecurity strategy.
In a context of severe economic and financial crisis in which the Member States are being forced to cut their defense budgets, it is when European projects are most needed.
That is why it is more important than ever to strengthen the role of the European Defence Agency, which is being very contested today.
I conclude by affirming that we can relaunch European security and defense, and do so with the project of the former President Barrot for the Council in December 2013.
Thank you very much to the four speakers.
Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, once again the defence of the general interests defended by the Commission and Parliament clashes with national selfishness that camps in the Council.
From the prior acceptance of the legitimacy of both positions, it is inexcusable to achieve a balance.
The relevance of the next financial framework is unquestionable.
The Spanish delegation of the PPE and I, on its behalf, reiterate that the proposal of the Presidency is, in our opinion, unacceptable.
A cut of seventy-five billion euros on the already inevitably scarce proposal of the European Commission is sterile and useless.
And not only that, the new direct link to agricultural and cohesion policies means going beyond the red line that Spain has set since the beginning of the work.
Ladies and gentlemen, it is no longer time to discuss a supposed dichotomy between austerity and growth.
Some of us are making efforts and sacrifices proven for deficit correction.
But Spain, like many other countries, needs to grow, increase economic activity and create jobs.
And with this budget, you don't get anywhere. Rather, it constitutes a missile the line of action.
Ladies and gentlemen, it is not possible to achieve more Europe with much fewer resources, and especially if what there is is distributed unjustly.

If that is the case, Spain will oppose a financial framework for the European Union that smooths and flattens the disappearance of growth possibilities and, above all, any vestige of solidarity. And this is precisely the direction that the European Council is taking.
Fortunately, this is not the path that the Commission has indicated, to whom we must thank for its efforts in pointing out a different route.

At this point, in the need of the Union, in the need of joint efforts, I want to thank Mr. Barroso for making a forceful statement on the interpretation of the Treaties for a supposed secessionist in the bosom of the Union the other day in Cadiz.

He made it clear, unequivocally as a guardian of the Treaties, that if a part of a Member State separes itself as an independent state, it will be considered a third country and, therefore, the declarations and effects of the Treaty itself will not affect it in any way.

I hope, Mr Vice President, in the absence of the President, that this can be collected and that this doctrine, sure and constant of the Commission, can continue to remain alive for the guarantee of all.
